page.title: 03LOCAL VILLAGERS
page.content: Mr and Mrs Prout live in Mylor. They have lived in the village for many years and have noticed quite a few changes.Mrs Prout was a district nurse during the war and Mr Prout owned the hardware store next door.Mylor was bombed during the war, a whole row of 5 cottages was destroyed in one raid alone.These cottages were situated in the Lemon Arms carpark. There were three water pumps in the village,the main one being in the centre.When the water mains were brought into the village none of the villagers were allowed to drink from the pumps and they were closed down.He also said that gas had never been brought into the village.Proper sewage amenities were put in after the war. Mrs Prout prefers living in an old cottage rather than a modern house.
